meanings.definition: An act of selecting or making a decision when faced with two or more possibilities.
meanings.sent1: Her choice of ice cream flavor was chocolate.
meanings.sent2: He had to make a choice between going to the park or staying home.
meanings.sent3: The cat's choice of napping spots always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The choice to pursue his dream was like stepping into a new world.
meanings.sent5: The choice to wear mismatched socks made her stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: The right or ability to make a decision.
meanings.sent1: Having the choice to pick her own outfit made her happy.
meanings.sent2: The students were grateful for the choice to work in groups or individually.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to believe he had the choice to choose his own dinner.
meanings.sent4: The choice to speak up gave her a sense of empowerment.
meanings.sent5: The choice to explore the unknown filled him with excitement.

meanings.definition: A range of possibilities from which one may choose.
meanings.sent1: The menu offered a wide choice of dishes to select from.
meanings.sent2: She was overwhelmed by the choice of colors for her new room.
meanings.sent3: The garden presented a choice of flowers that seemed endless.
meanings.sent4: The choice of paths in the forest led to different adventures.
meanings.sent5: The choice of books at the library was like a treasure trove waiting to be discovered.
